place_description:
Welcome to Kunu Coffee Concord, a specialty coffee bar located just inside Gibson Mill Market. We're here to spread positive vibes around Lake Norman, NC through artisanal coffee and tea. Our baristas make every drink with precision, using only the highest quality, ethically-sourced beans, locally sourced A2 milks and organic syrups.

Gibson Mill Market is Concord's top community-driven gathering spot with a locally sourced food hall, craft breweries, and, of course, coffee! Whether you're working remote or need a place to bring the kids, our Concord is your go-to spot to start your weekday morning or brighten up your weekend.

reviews_data.review_text: Chai coffee was the best I've had.

This cozy coffee shop is tucked inside Gibson Mill Market, making it a convenient stop during a visit.

The prices are reasonable for high-quality coffee, and they offer a full range of classic drinks along with a few creative, handcrafted lattes for those looking to try something unique.  They also have a selection of freshly baked goods that pair perfectly with your coffee.

What really stands out, though, is the friendly and attentive service. The baristas are fantastic; welcoming, skilled, and clearly passionate about what they do.   I had a cappuccino that was perfectly balanced, and she tried "The Brunette," a blend of lavender and velvety chocolate. Both drinks were excellent, we enjoyed them a lot.  Overall, a great spot to relax and enjoy a well-made cup of coffee!
Can't have much caffeine so I got decaf. The pumpkin spice latte is delicious. Not too sweet!
The employee was very inviting. She told us a bit about the car show they hold here every 2nd Saturday.  The coffee definitely hit the spot.

Got a fall themed coffee that was delicious! Of all the pumpkin coffees I've had this one had the most favor of actual pumpkin in my opinion, which I loved! The barista was also friendly, helpful, and did a cute leaf latte art.

We went on a weekday afternoon so it wasn't busy at all then
I love trying new coffee, but this coffee is not good. It's very watery.
Cold brew tasted like old, bitter coffee watered down and poured over ice. We were disappointed to spend $13 on two ice coffees that were not drinkable. Super bummer! Cute space and location.

They have babycinos for the kids which I so appreciate  there's also a lot of space to sit. The place is very child friendly and easy to get to. Thank you for being so family friendly, it's hard to find these days :)

Can't believe people not reviewing 5 stars by how nice the coffee and food is in here

It is a bit pricey. But if you want quality, maybe you'll have to pay a little bit more (it's not even that bad)

Nice coffee spot inside of Gibson Mill market.

Prices are about standard for good coffee.

They have all the standard drinks as well as a small selection of artisanal lattes.

They also have fresh baked goods and merch to buy.
Great espresso, great drip. Knowledgeable, friendly barista
Excellent coffee and very friendly staff! Great place to sit down with some food from the other vendors or grab and go

My husband comes here regularly with his coworkers from the fire department. He has always came home just amazed and genuinely pleased with his coffee and service each time. Finally, today he took me and it did not dissapoint. The gentleman who made our coffee had a phenomenal attitude and truly took pride in his work.  It was very clean and inviting and most of all the coffee, we order a teddy, was DELICOUS. I was skeptical from its ingredients and being picky but wow I can't wait to buy it again. We had out 2 children with us as well so we order them a banana chocolate muffin. It was absolutely delicious as well. I can't not praise this place enough. Definitely worth going and trying! You won't regret. They have muffins, cinnamon roll, hot coffee for 6 bucks or iced for 6.50. Worth every penny.

Best specialty coffee in Concord/Kannapolis area. TO FIND: Inside the Gibson Mill Market, directly to the right of the doors. The owners have revamped the coffeeshop, continuing to provide stellar coffee, including a Rwandan natural process. The company is saturated with highly skilled and knowledgeable experts who genuinely care about the product and people the serve, from the baristas to the owners. If you've enjoyed the Lake Forest locations in the past and find yourself in Concord, I highly recommend.
My favorite place for a chai latte. Love the staff and the community atmosphere they create. Delicious pastries sourced from neighboring food stall, Cara's Cookies.
